20101214140301.000|20101214140311.000|TR0|Democrats believe they'll manage
20101214140311.000|20101214140321.000|TR0|to get the nine Republican votes
20101214140321.000|20101214140331.000|TR0|necessary to win the majority.
20101214140331.000|20101214140336.000|TR0|But as RT's Gayane Chichakyan
20101214140336.000|20101214140341.000|TR0|reports, with the vote expected
20101214140341.000|20101214140351.000|TR0|on Wednesday, it seems some are
20101214140351.000|20101214140401.000|TR0|trying to stall the deal.
20101214140401.000|20101214140406.000|TR0|
20101214140406.000|20101214140411.000|TR0|In terms of substance, theres
20101214140411.000|20101214140421.000|TR0|nothing that can stop the new
20101214140421.000|20101214140431.000|TR0|Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty
20101214140431.000|20101214140441.000|TR0|from being ratified. Key
20101214140441.000|20101214140446.000|TR0|questions, concerns, whatever
20101214140446.000|20101214140451.000|TR0|senators had during the course
20101214140451.000|20101214140501.000|TR0|of the past 8 months of
20101214140501.000|20101214140511.000|TR0|hearings, were all addressed. "I
20101214140511.000|20101214140521.000|TR0|do think that we have done our
20101214140521.000|20101214140526.000|TR0|homework regarding to the new
20101214140526.000|20101214140531.000|TR0|START treaty and that it is in a
20101214140531.000|20101214140541.000|TR0|good situation to ratify it in
20101214140541.000|20101214140551.000|TR0|this lame duck session." It has
20101214140551.000|20101214140601.000|TR0|the unanimous support of the
20101214140601.000|20101214140606.000|TR0|countrys military, many top
20101214140606.000|20101214140611.000|TR0|officials, former and present,
20101214140611.000|20101214140621.000|TR0|have testified in favour of the
20101214140621.000|20101214140631.000|TR0|treaty. Now several Republican
20101214140631.000|20101214140641.000|TR0|senators say the votes are there
20101214140641.000|20101214140646.000|TR0|and the new START will most
20101214140646.000|20101214140651.000|TR0|likely be ratified by the end of
20101214140651.000|20101214140701.000|TR0|this week. It  seems the only
20101214140701.000|20101214140711.000|TR0|thing that could be in the way
20101214140711.000|20101214140721.000|TR0|of the NEW START are PARTISAN
20101214140721.000|20101214140726.000|TR0|GAMES, POLITICAL BARGAINING,
20101214140726.000|20101214140731.000|TR0|which have nothing to do with
20101214140731.000|20101214140741.000|TR0|the treaty itself and its
20101214140741.000|20101214140751.000|TR0|content. STAND-UP: "Speaking of
20101214140751.000|20101214140756.000|TR0|bargaining, at some point the
20101214140756.000|20101214140801.000|TR0|Senates minority leader, Mitch
20101214140801.000|20101214140811.000|TR0|Mcconnell, came out and said
20101214140811.000|20101214140821.000|TR0|Republicans would block any of
20101214140821.000|20101214140831.000|TR0|the Democrats initiatives IF
20101214140831.000|20101214140836.000|TR0|they dont extend tax cuts for
20101214140836.000|20101214140841.000|TR0|the rich. So you get a sense of
20101214140841.000|20101214140851.000|TR0|the extent of the bargaining
20101214140851.000|20101214140901.000|TR0|culture on Capitol Hill. The
20101214140901.000|20101214140911.000|TR0|substance of the treaty, whether
20101214140911.000|20101214140916.000|TR0|its bad or good for America,
20101214140916.000|20101214140921.000|TR0|has really long stopped being
20101214140921.000|20101214140931.000|TR0|the focus of discussions here in
20101214140931.000|20101214140941.000|TR0|Washington." To the point, when
20101214140941.000|20101214140951.000|TR0|it could become a threat to the
20101214140951.000|20101214140956.000|TR0|U.S. national security. SB
20101214140956.000|20101214141001.000|TR0|BARACK OBAMA "A world without
20101214141001.000|20101214141011.000|TR0|binding U.S.-Russia arms control
20101214141011.000|20101214141021.000|TR0|treaty is a more dangerous
20101214141021.000|20101214141031.000|TR0|place." The Obama administration
20101214141031.000|20101214141036.000|TR0|is going out of its way to have
20101214141036.000|20101214141041.000|TR0|the deal ratified. The
20101214141041.000|20101214141051.000|TR0|presidents arguably major
20101214141051.000|20101214141101.000|TR0|foreign policy achievement is on
20101214141101.000|20101214141111.000|TR0|the line. Not only does START
20101214141111.000|20101214141116.000|TR0|cut the nuclear arsenals of both
20101214141116.000|20101214141121.000|TR0|countries by a third, its also
20101214141121.000|20101214141131.000|TR0|seen as a symbol of trust
20101214141131.000|20101214141141.000|TR0|between the two nuclear
20101214141141.000|20101214141151.000|TR0|super-powers. SB BARACK OBAMA
20101214141151.000|20101214141156.000|TR0|"RUSSIA HAS CO-OPERATED WITH US
20101214141156.000|20101214141201.000|TR0|ON CRITICAL SECURITY ISSUES LIKE
20101214141201.000|20101214141211.000|TR0|IRAN SANCTIONS, AFGHANISTAN...

20101214141241.000|20101214141251.000|TR0|and Americas reputation

20101214142011.000|20101214142016.000|TR0|
20101214142016.000|20101214142021.000|TR0|Russia will buy at least one
20101214142021.000|20101214142031.000|TR0|Mistral helicopter-carrier from
20101214142031.000|20101214142041.000|TR0|France. The sides are currently
20101214142041.000|20101214142046.000|TR0|agreeing the price of the deal,
20101214142046.000|20101214142051.000|TR0|which will be the largest
20101214142051.000|20101214142101.000|TR0|military transaction between
20101214142101.000|20101214142111.000|TR0|Russia and the NATO country.
20101214142111.000|20101214142121.000|TR0|RT's Yegor Piskunov reveals the
20101214142121.000|20101214142126.000|TR0|details of the long negotiated
20101214142126.000|20101214142131.000|TR0|agreement.
20101214142131.000|20101214142141.000|TR0|
20101214142141.000|20101214142151.000|TR0|Dmitry Vasilyev, from the
20101214142151.000|20101214142201.000|TR0|specialist Moscow-based magazine
20101214142201.000|20101214142206.000|TR0|"Export of Arms", says the
20101214142206.000|20101214142211.000|TR0|Mistral deal will play a major
20101214142211.000|20101214142221.000|TR0|role in boosting Russia's
20101214142221.000|20101214142231.000|TR0|industry rather than its
20101214142231.000|20101214142241.000|TR0|military sector.
20101214142241.000|20101214142246.000|TR0|
20101214142246.000|20101214142251.000|TR0|We already have certain
20101214142251.000|20101214142301.000|TR0|technological cooperation with
20101214142301.000|20101214142311.000|TR0|France, and there are certain
20101214142311.000|20101214142321.000|TR0|mechanisms in place. Therefore,
20101214142321.000|20101214142326.000|TR0|France has been chosen, as it
20101214142326.000|20101214142331.000|TR0|seems that it will be easier
20101214142331.000|20101214142341.000|TR0|working with France politically
20101214142341.000|20101214142351.000|TR0|than with South Korea or the
20101214142351.000|20101214142401.000|TR0|Netherlands, who have also
20101214142401.000|20101214142406.000|TR0|submitted their projects. Now
20101214142406.000|20101214142411.000|TR0|its common practice around the
20101214142411.000|20101214142421.000|TR0|world, that when buying weapons
20101214142421.000|20101214142431.000|TR0|and military equipment, the
20101214142431.000|20101214142436.000|TR0|importing country sets its own
20101214142436.000|20101214142441.000|TR0|requirements. For instance we
20101214142441.000|20101214142451.000|TR0|buy your weapons, while you
20101214142451.000|20101214142501.000|TR0|organize licensed production in
20101214142501.000|20101214142511.000|TR0|our country and provide us with
20101214142511.000|20101214142516.000|TR0|your technology etc. So,
20101214142516.000|20101214142521.000|TR0|naturally, Russia doesnn't just
20101214142521.000|20101214142531.000|TR0|want to buy ships, but also
20101214142531.000|20101214142541.000|TR0|produce them itself mastering
20101214142541.000|20101214142551.000|TR0|foreign technology. I dont know
20101214142551.000|20101214142556.000|TR0|how its going to fit into our
20101214142556.000|20101214142601.000|TR0|military system, but it will
20101214142601.000|20101214142611.000|TR0|give our industry an edge.
20101214142611.000|20101214142621.000|TR0|Mistral will be supplied with
20101214142621.000|20101214142631.000|TR0|our equipment, of course, and
20101214142631.000|20101214142636.000|TR0|our enterprises will participate
20101214142636.000|20101214142641.000|TR0|in this process.
20101214142641.000|20101214142651.000|TR0|
20101214142651.000|20101214142701.000|TR0|One billion Euros, that's how
20101214142701.000|20101214142711.000|TR0|much some experts believe the
20101214142711.000|20101214142716.000|TR0|Mistral contract is worth to the
20101214142716.000|20101214142721.000|TR0|French economy. In RT's
20101214142721.000|20101214142731.000|TR0|interview show Spotlight, coming
20101214142731.000|20101214142741.000|TR0|your way in 20 minutes time, we
20101214142741.000|20101214142751.000|TR0|hear from ¬Christine Lagarde,
20101214142751.000|20101214142756.000|TR0|the French Finance Minister, who
20101214142756.000|20101214142801.000|TR0|says if the deal is complete, it
20101214142801.000|20101214142811.000|TR0|will reflect a broader
20101214142811.000|20101214142821.000|TR0|partnership between Russia and
20101214142821.000|20101214142826.000|TR0|France. Here's a quick preview..
20101214142826.000|20101214142831.000|TR0|
20101214142831.000|20101214142841.000|TR0|A young Russian woman, arrested
20101214142841.000|20101214142851.000|TR0|in London almost two weeks ago
20101214142851.000|20101214142901.000|TR0|on suspicion of spying, has been
20101214142901.000|20101214142906.000|TR0|released on bail. 25-year-old
20101214142906.000|20101214142911.000|TR0|Katia Zatuliveter, who's now
20101214142911.000|20101214142921.000|TR0|facing deportation, worked as an
20101214142921.000|20101214142931.000|TR0|assistant to British MP Mike
20101214142931.000|20101214142941.000|TR0|Hancock. The UK says she used
20101214142941.000|20101214142946.000|TR0|her position to gather
20101214142946.000|20101214142951.000|TR0|information on the country's
20101214142951.000|20101214143001.000|TR0|nuclear facilities. Let's cross
20101214143001.000|20101214143011.000|TR0|live now to RT's Laura Emmett,
20101214143011.000|20101214143021.000|TR0|who managed to catch up with
20101214143021.000|20101214143026.000|TR0|her...
20101214143026.000|20101214143031.000|TR0|
20101214143031.000|20101214143041.000|TR0|The founder of whistleblowing

20101214143051.000|20101214143101.000|TR0|court, hearing whether he will
20101214143101.000|20101214143106.000|TR0|be granted bail.
20101214143106.000|20101214143111.000|TR0|

20101214143121.000|20101214143131.000|TR0|custody after Stockholm issued

20101214143141.000|20101214143146.000|TR0|with rape allegations which
20101214143146.000|20101214143151.000|TR0|Assange firmly denies.
20101214143151.000|20101214143201.000|TR0|

20101214143211.000|20101214143221.000|TR0|although the country's chief
20101214143221.000|20101214143226.000|TR0|prosecutor cancelled a previous
20101214143226.000|20101214143231.000|TR0|warrant saying there was no

20101214143241.000|20101214143251.000|TR0|committed the crime. The
20101214143251.000|20101214143256.000|TR0|Wikileaks founder's supporters

20101214143301.000|20101214143311.000|TR0|The site is still operating and

20101214143321.000|20101214143331.000|TR0|confidential American diplomatic

20101214143721.000|20101214143726.000|TR0|Space Station. RTs Peter Oliver
20101214143726.000|20101214143731.000|TR0|reports on the rocket's journey
